intro: Onosma samarica, commonly known as the Samarkand poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. Its flowers are tubular and often have a distinctive crown of stamens, which is a notable botanical feature. Onosma samarica is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh climates.
